docs.snippet: For the Muslims in the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, there are fewer limitations on religion. “Life for the Hui is very good,” an imam said....
docs.lead_paragraph: For the Muslims in the Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region, there are fewer limitations on religion. “Life for the Hui is very good,” an imam said.
docs.abstract: Wuzhong Journal; thousand-year-old Muslim community thrives in China, where Communist Party severely restricts Islamic practice; offers sharp contrast with beleaguered Muslims in Xinjiang, who have suffered under country's crackdown on extremism; ethnic Hui minority enjoys largely peaceful relations with Party, which has recently sought to promote region's economic development.

headline.main: Light Government Touch Lets China’s Hui Practice Islam in the Open
headline.print_headline: In One Part of China, Officials’ Light Touch Lets Islam Flourish
